license fee shall be charged for any license issued at any time during the first month of such license year. The license fee shall be
paid and there shall be no refund of any portion of the same except that the initial license fee to be paid shall be reduced in
proportion to the full calendar months which have expired in the year prior to the issuance of such license. No license shall be
issued for any term less than the balance of the unexpired license year. (1997 Code)
3-2-7: INVESTIGATION; APPROVAL OF LICENSE:
A. Investigation: All applications for a retailer's license shall be filed with the local liquor control commissioner who shall investigate all of
the statements contained in each application.
B. Examination Of Applicant: The local liquor control commissioner shall have the right to examine, or cause to be examined, under
oath, any applicant for a local license or for a renewal thereof, or any licensee upon whom notice of revocation or suspension has
been served as provided by statute, and to examine or cause to be examined the books and records of any such applicant or
licensee, to hear testimony and take proof for his/her information in the performance of his/her duties, and for such purpose to issue
subpoenas which shall be effective in any part of this state. For the purpose of obtaining any of the information desired by the local
liquor control commissioner under this section, such commissioner may authorize his/her agent to act on his/her behalf as provided
by statute. (1997 Code)
C. Issuance: Upon investigation, if the local liquor control commissioner shall be satisfied that the matter and things contained are true
and that the applicant is of good moral character, entitled to a license, and that the applicant has complied with all the requirements
of this chapter, the local liquor control commissioner may with the approval and consent of the majority of the city council in
attendance, approve the same and upon the receipt of the required license fee, issue a license in accordance with the provisions of
this chapter. (Ord. 0-17-12, 12-10-2012)
3-2-8: BOND:
Each person to whom a retailer's license is about to be issued, under the provisions of this chapter, shall execute a penal bond in the
form and with sureties acceptable to the local liquor control commissioner in the sum of two hundred dollars ($200.00), conditioned upon
faithful performance and observance of the provisions of the laws of Illinois, and of this chapter, and further conditioned upon the prompt
payment of any fine which may be levied or assessed against any licensee for the violation of any of the penal provisions of the state
and this chapter, and such bond shall, upon approval, be filed in the office of the local liquor control commissioner. (1997 Code)
3-2-9: LOCATION RESTRICTIONS:
A. Separate License Required: A separate license shall be required for and with respect to each location or premises at which or upon
which any liquor, wine or beer is to be sold or offered for sale at retail.
B. Business Or Residential Districts:
1. Approval Of Adjacent Landowners: No retailer's class D license shall be granted to any applicant for any premises within the
corporate limits of the city where the same is located in any block in the city which is at the time of the application either wholly or
partly devoted to business uses or residential uses unless the applicant shall first file in the office of the local liquor control
commissioner a petition signed by a majority of property owners of the frontage within one hundred feet (100') in each direction of
the proposed location on both sides of the street on which the proposed location shall front, signifying their willingness to have a
license issued; provided, that in any case if the property owners of at least one hundred feet (100') of the property immediately
adjacent to or abutting on any side of the proposed location shall not appear as signers on the petition, no license shall be issued;
provided further, that the signature of any adjacent property owner who is then conducting a place of business in the block under a
license issued shall not be deemed necessary for the purpose of this subsection B1.
2. Vacation Of Premises: In the event any location to which a license is issued on the petition of property owners as above shall
become and remain vacant for a period of five (5) or more months consecutively, no new license shall issue to the premises
without the necessary petition of property holders being again presented in accordance with the provisions of this subsection B.
C. Proximity To Church, School, Etc.: No license shall be issued for the sale at retail of any alcoholic liquor within one hundred feet
(100') of any church, school, hospital, home for the aged or indigent persons or for veterans, their wives or children, or any military or
naval station; provided, that this prohibition shall not apply to clubs or restaurants, food shops or other places where the sale of
alcoholic liquor is not the principal business carried on, if such place of business not exempted shall have been established for such
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 46/251
purpose prior to the taking effect of this Chapter; nor to the renewal of a license for the sale of alcoholic liquor on premises within one
hundred feet (100') of any church where such church has been established within such one hundred feet (100') since the issuance of
the original license.
D. Stores Selling School Supplies, Lunches: No license shall be issued to any person for the sale at retail of any alcoholic liquor at any
store or other place of business where the majority of customers are minors of school age or where the principal business transacted
consists of school books, school supplies, food, lunches or drinks for such minors.
E. View From Street:
1. Clear View Required; Exceptions: In premises in which the sale of alcoholic liquor for consumption on the premises is licensed,
other than in restaurants, hotels or clubs, no screen, blind, curtain, partition, article or thing shall be permitted in the windows or
upon the doors of such licensed premises nor inside such premises which shall prevent a clear view into the interior of such
licensed premises from the street, road or sidewalk at all times, and no booth, screen, partition or other obstruction nor any
arrangement of lights or lighting shall be permitted in or about the interior of such premises which shall prevent a full view of the
entire interior of such premises, and the entire space used by the public must be so located that there shall be a full view of the
same from the street, road of sidewalk.
2. Lighting: All rooms where alcoholic liquor is sold for consumption on the premises shall be continually lighted during business
hours by natural or artificial white lights so that all parts of the interior of the premises shall be clearly visible.
3. Violation: In case the view into such licensed premises required by the foregoing provisions shall be wilfully obscured by the
licensee or by licensee wilfully suffered to be obscured or obstructed, such license may be revoked in the manner herein provided.
4. Plans, Drawings And Photographs Required: In order to enforce the provision of this subsection, the City shall have the right to
require the filing with the Local Liquor Control Commissioner of plans, drawings and photographs showing the clear line of the
view as above required.
F. Change Of Location: A liquor dealer's license shall permit the sale of alcoholic liquor only in the premises described in the application
and license. Such location may be changed only upon the written permission to make such change issued by the Local Liquor
Control Commissioner. No change of location shall be permitted unless the proposed new location is a proper one for the retail sale
of alcoholic liquor under the Statute of the State and the provisions of this City Code. (1997 Code)
3-2-10: POSTING LICENSE:
Every person licensed in accordance with the provisions of this Chapter shall immediately post and keep posted while in force, in a
conspicuous place on the premises, the license so issued. (1997 Code)
3-2-11: SANITARY CONDITIONS:
All premises used for the sale of alcoholic liquor, or for the storage of such liquor for sale, shall be kept in a clean and sanitary condition,
and shall be kept in full compliance with the Code provisions regulating the condition of premises used for the storage or sale of food for
human consumption. (1997 Code)
3-2-12: HOURS OF SALE:
A. Consumption On Premises: Unless otherwise herein provided, it shall be unlawful to keep open or permit to be open any place where
alcoholic liquor is sold for consumption on the premises between the hours of one o'clock (1:00) A.M. and six o'clock (6:00) A.M. of
any day of the week.
B. Package Liquor: It shall be unlawful to keep open or permit to be open under a Class A license as issued by the City, any package
liquor store before the hour of five o'clock (5:00) A.M. and subsequent to the hour of eleven o'clock (11:00) P.M. on any day of the
week.
C. Class B: It shall be lawful to keep open or permit to be open any establishment operating under a class B license as issued by the
city during normal business hours. (1997 Code)
3-2-13: PROHIBITED ACTS:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 47/251
A. Sale To Minors, Intoxicated Persons Or Habitual Drunkards: No person licensed under this chapter shall sell, or permit to be sold, any
"alcoholic liquor", "beer" or "wine" as defined, to any person under the age of twenty one (21) years, or to any person notoriously
addicted by habit to the abnormal use of the same.
B. Written Affidavit: No licensee or licensee's agent shall require any person suspected of being under the permissible drinking age to
sign a written affidavit of age as well as requiring written identification and proof of age. (1997 Code)
C. Gambling: There shall be no illegal card games or illegal gambling allowed on any premises licensed to sell alcoholic liquor, except
for video gaming as authorized by the Illinois legislature and as licensed by the Illinois gaming board, which shall be allowed. (Ord.
0-09-12, 8-27-2012)
D. Minors Drawing, Pouring Or Mixing Liquor: No person under the age of twenty one (21) shall attend any bar to draw, pour or mix any
alcoholic liquor, beer or wine in any licensed retail premises.
E. Delivery On Sunday: No person licensed under this chapter shall order or receive delivery of any liquor, beer or wine on Sunday at
the premises so licensed, or at any other premises.
F. Peddling: It shall be unlawful to peddle alcoholic liquor in the city. (1997 Code)
3-2-14: MINORS:
A. Purchase Or Obtaining Prohibited: It shall be unlawful for any person under the legal age as defined by the state to be in possession
of any alcoholic liquor in any place in the city. Any person convicted of a violation of this provision shall be subject to penalty as
provided in section 1-4-1 of this code.
B. Possession: It shall be unlawful for any person under the legal age as defined by the state to be in possession of any alcoholic liquor
in any place in the city. Any person convicted of a violation of this provision shall be subject to penalty as provided in section 1-4-1 of
this code.
C. Misrepresentation Of Age: It shall be unlawful for any person under legal age as defined from time to time by the state to
misrepresent his or her age for the purpose of purchasing or obtaining alcoholic liquor in any tavern or other place in the city where
alcoholic liquor is sold.
D. Presence Prohibited:
1. It shall be unlawful for any holder of a retailer's liquor license or his/her agent or employee to suffer or permit any minor to remain
in any room or compartment adjoining or adjacent to or situated in the room or place where such licensed premises is located;
provided, that this subsection shall not apply to any minor who is accompanied by his or her parent or guardian, or to any licensed
premises which derives its principal business from the sale of, or services of, commodities other than alcoholic liquor. In addition to
all other fines and penalties, the local liquor control commissioner may revoke or suspend the retail liquor license for any violation
of this subsection.
2. No person under the age of twenty one (21) shall frequent any tavern or other place in the city where alcoholic liquor is sold.
E. Parental Responsibility: It shall be unlawful for any parent or guardian to permit any minor child of which he or she may be the parent
or guardian to violate any of the provisions of this section.
F. Sale, Gift Or Delivery Prohibited: It shall be unlawful to sell, give or deliver alcoholic liquor to any minor.
G. Display Of Warning: In every tavern or other place in the city where alcoholic liquor is sold there shall be displayed at all times in a
prominent place a printed card which shall read substantially as follows:
WARNING TO PERSONS UNDER THE AGE OF 21
Under the ordinances of the City of Colona, any person under the age of 21 years who, for the purpose of buying, accepting or
receiving alcoholic liquor, beer or wine represents that he or she is 21 years of age or over shall be subject to a fine of up to $200.00.
(1997 Code)
H. Consumption: It shall be unlawful for any person under the age of twenty one (21) to consume alcohol beverages in the city.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 48/251
1. The penalty for violating this subsection shall fall under the general penalty provisions.
2. This offense shall also be included as a no contest option. The no contest fine is one hundred dollars ($100.00). (Ord. 00-08, 2-28-
2000)
3-2-15: EMPLOYEES:
A. Disease: It shall be unlawful for any person to employ in any premises used for the sale of alcoholic liquor any person who is afflicted
with, or who is a carrier of, any contagious, infectious or venereal diseases; and it shall be unlawful for any person afflicted with or
who is a carrier of any such disease to work in or about any such premises or to engage in any way in the handling, preparation or
distribution of such liquor.
B. Minor: It shall be unlawful for any person to employ, for the purpose of serving alcoholic liquor, any person who is under legal age as
defined by the statutes of the state in effect from time to time. (1997 Code)
3-2-16: RENEWAL OF LICENSE:
Any licensee shall have and be given the right to a renewal or reissue of such license at the same place upon compliance with the
ordinances now in force in the city or which may be passed governing the issuance of such licenses; provided, however, the privilege of
renewal and/or reissue provided in this section shall apply only so long as the license in each case shall have been kept in force
continually and uninterruptedly in the name of the licensee or licensee's successor in interest, and nothing shall be deemed to restrict
the right of the local liquor control commissioner to revoke any such license. (1997 Code)
3-2-17: TRANSFER OF LICENSE:
A license shall be a purely personal privilege, good for not to exceed one year after issuance unless sooner revoked as in this chapter
provided, and shall not constitute property, nor shall it be subject to being encumbered or hypothecated. Such licenses shall cease upon
the death of the licensee; provided, that executors or administrators of the estate of any deceased licensee, when such estate consists
in part of alcoholic liquor, may continue the business of the sale or manufacture of alcoholic liquor under order of the appropriate court,
and may exercise the privileges of the deceased or insolvent or bankruptcy until the expiration of such license, but not longer than six
(6) months after the death, bankruptcy or insolvency of such licensee. A refund shall be made of that portion of the license fees paid for
any period in which the licensee shall be prevented from operating under such license in accordance with the provisions of this section.
(1997 Code)
3-2-18: DUPLICATE LICENSE:
Whenever such license shall be lost or destroyed, a duplicate shall be issued by the local liquor control commissioner upon application
made by the licensee, who also shall take a verified statement of such loss or destruction. (1997 Code)
3-2-19: REVOCATION; SUSPENSION1:
A. Suspension By Local Liquor Control Commissioner: The local liquor control commissioner may suspend or revoke any license issued
under any one or more of the following circumstances:
1. When the local liquor control commissioner is satisfied that the licensee has violated any of the provisions of this chapter or any
valid resolution enacted by the city council or any applicable rule or regulation established by the local liquor control commissioner
that is consistent with the law.
2. The violation by the licensee of any law of the state relating to the regulation of the sale of liquor.
3. The wilful making of any false statement by the licensee as to a material fact in an application for a license.
B. Nonuse: When any license is voluntarily not used by the licensee within a period of sixty (60) days from the date of issuance of said
license, said license is suspended. Further, if such license is issued and used by the licensee and licensee voluntarily ceases to use
such license for a period of sixty (60) days, the license is suspended. The suspension for nonuse shall not apply to a licensee or
applicant whose place of business is not yet constructed unless such construction of the business premises is not completed within
one hundred eighty (180) days after application for a liquor license. (1997 Code)
3-2-20: PENALTY:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 49/251
A. Should a license holder violate any provisions of this chapter, the license holder shall for the first and each subsequent offense, be
subject to penalty as provided in section 1-4-1 of this code, or in the discretion of the local liquor control commissioner, the license
may be revoked or suspended.
B. Any person not holding a Colona liquor license who violates any provisions of this chapter shall be subject to penalty as provided in
section 1-4-1 of this code.
C. Persons violating this chapter who are not holders of a Colona liquor license are eligible to have the offense handled pursuant to the
"no contest" procedures as enacted by city ordinance. The "no contest" fine for a violation of this chapter is hereby set at one
hundred dollars ($100.00). (Ord. 99-03, 3-22-1999)
Chapter 3
MUNICIPAL UTILITY TAX1
3-3-1: DEFINITIONS:
For the purpose of this Chapter, the following definitions shall apply:
GROSS RECEIPTS: A. The consideration received for the transmission of messages, or for distributing, supplying, furnishing or selling
gas, or electricity for use or consumption and not for resale, as the case may be; and for all services rendered in connection therewith
valued in money, whether received in money or otherwise, including cash, credit, services and property of every kind and material, and
for all services rendered therewith; and shall be determined without any deduction on account of the cost of transmitting said messages
without any deduction on account of the cost of the service, product or commodity supplied, at the cost of materials used, labor or
service cost, or any other expenses whatsoever.
B. As pertains to the "gross receipts" from the telephone company servicing the City, "gross receipts" means the consideration
received for supplying telephone service, and for all services rendered in connection therewith valued in money, whether received
in money or otherwise, including cash, credit, services and property of every kind and material, and for all services rendered
therewith; and shall be determined without any deduction on account of the cost of the service, product or commodity supplied, the
cost of materials used, labor or service cost, and any other expenses whatsoever.
PERSON MAINTAINING A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THIS STATE: Any person having or maintaining within this State, directly or by a
subsidiary or other affiliate, an office, generation facility, distribution facility, transmission facility, sales office or other place of business,
or any employee, agent or other representative operating within this State under the authority of the person or its subsidiary or other
affiliate, irrespective of whether such place of business or agent or other representative is located in this State permanently or
temporarily, or whether such person, subsidiary or other affiliate is licensed or qualified to do business in this State.
PERSONS: Any natural individual, firm, trust, estate, partnership, association, joint stock company, joint adventure, corporation,
municipal corporation or political subdivision of the State, or a receiver, trustee, conservator or the representative appointed by order of
court. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no Municipal utility tax shall be assessed upon bills for utility service rendered to the Municipality
itself.
PURCHASE AT RETAIL: Any acquisition of electricity by a purchaser for purposes of use or consumption, and not for resale, but shall
not include the use of electricity by a public utility, as defined in section 8-11-2 of the Illinois Municipal Code2, directly in the generation,
production, transmission, delivery or sale of electricity.
PURCHASER: Any person who uses or consumes, within the corporate limits of the City, electricity acquired in a purchase at retail,
other than from an exempt purchaser.
TRANSMITTING MESSAGES: In addition to the usual and popular meaning of a person-to-person communication, shall include the
furnishing, for a consideration, of services or facilities (whether owned or leased) or both, to persons in connection with the transmission
of messages where such persons do not, in turn, receive any consideration in connection therewith, but shall not include such furnishing
of services or facilities to persons of the transmission of messages to the extent that any such services or facilities for the transmission
of messages are furnished for a consideration, by such persons to other persons, for the transmission of messages. (1997 Code; amd.
Ord. 99-05, 6-14-1999)
3-3-2: TAX IMPOSED:
A tax is imposed on all persons engaged in the following occupations or privileges:
A. Electricity:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 50/251
1. Tax:
a. Pursuant to section 8-11-2 of the Illinois Municipal Code3 and any and all other applicable authority, a tax is imposed upon the
privilege of using or consuming electricity acquired in a purchase at retail and used or consumed within the corporate limits of
the City at the following rates, calculated on a monthly basis for each purchaser:
(1) For the first 2,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month: $0.004514 per kilowatt-hour;
(2) For the next 48,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month: $0.002962 per kilowatt-hour;
(3) For the next 50,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month: $0.002664 per kilowatt-hour;
(4) For the next 400,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month: $0.002590 per kilowatt-hour;
(5) For the next 500,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month: $0.002516 per kilowatt-hour;
(6) For the next 2,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month: $0.002368 per kilowatt-hour;
(7) For the next 2,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month: $0.002331 per kilowatt-hour;
(8) For the next 5,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month: $0.002294 per kilowatt-hour;
(9) For the next 10,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month: $0.002257 per kilowatt-hour;
(10) For all electricity used or consumed in excess of 20,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month: $0.002220 per
kilowatt-hour.
b. The tax is in addition to all taxes, fees and other revenue measures imposed by the City, the State or any other political
subdivision of the State.
c. Notwithstanding any other provision of this subsection, the tax shall not be imposed if and to the extent that imposition or
collection of the tax would violate the Constitution or statutes of the United States or the constitution of the State of Illinois.
d. The tax shall be imposed with respect to the use or consumption of electricity by residential customers beginning with the first
bill issued on or after August 1, 1999; and with respect to the use or consumption of electricity by nonresidential customers
beginning with the first bill issued to such customers for delivery services in accordance with section 16-104 of the Public
Utilities Act4, or the first bill issued to such customers on or after January 1, 2001, whichever issuance occurs sooner.
2. Collection Of Tax:
a. Subject to the provision of this subsection regarding the delivery of electricity to resellers, the tax imposed under this Chapter
shall be collected from purchasers by the person maintaining a place of business in this State who delivers electricity to such
purchasers. This tax shall constitute a debt of the purchaser to the person who delivers the electricity to the purchaser and is
recoverable at the same time and in the same manner as the original charge for delivering the electricity.
b. Any tax required to be collected by this subsection, and any tax in fact collected, shall constitute a debt owed to the City by the
person delivering the electricity, provided, that the person delivering electricity shall be allowed credit for such tax related to
deliveries of electricity the charges for which are written off as uncollectible, and provided further, that if such charges are
thereafter collected, the delivering supplier shall be obligated to remit such tax.
c. Persons delivering electricity shall collect the tax from the purchaser by adding such tax to the gross charge for delivering the
electricity shall also be authorized to add to such gross charge an amount equal to three percent (3%) of the tax they collect to
reimburse them for their expense incurred in keeping records, billing customers, preparing the filing returns, remitting the tax
and supplying data to the City upon request.
3. Tax Remittance And Return:
a. Every tax collector shall, on a monthly basis, file a return on a form prescribed by the City. The return and accompanying
remittance shall be due on or before the last day of the month.
b. Following the month during which the tax is collected of or is required to be collected of or is required to be collected under
subsection A2 of this Section.
c. If the person delivering electricity fails to collect the tax from the purchaser or is excused from collecting the tax under
subsection A4 of this Section, then the purchaser shall file a return in a form prescribed by the City and pay the tax directly to
the City on or before the last day of the month following the month during which the electricity is used or consumed.
4. Resales:
a. Electricity that is delivered to a person in the City shall be considered to be for use and consumption by that person unless the
person receiving the electricity has an active resale number issued by the Director of Finance and furnishes that number to the
person who delivers the electricity and certifies to that person that the sale is either entirely or partially nontaxable as a sale for
resale.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 51/251
b. If a person who receives electricity in the Municipality claims to be an authorized reseller of electricity, that person shall apply to
the Municipal Clerk for a resale number. The application shall state facts showing why it is not liable for the tax imposed by this
subsection on any purchases of electricity and shall furnish such additional information as the Director of Finance may
reasonably require.
c. Upon approval of the application, the Director of Finance shall assign a resale number to the applicant and shall certify the
number to the applicant.
d. The Director of Finance may cancel the resale number of any person if the person fails to pay any tax payable under this
subsection for electricity used or consumed by the person, or if the number: 1) was obtained through misrepresentation, or 2) is
no longer necessary because the person has discontinued making resales.
e. (1) If a reseller has acquired electricity partly for use or consumption and partly for resale, the reseller shall pay the tax imposed
by this subsection directly to the City pursuant to subsection A2b of this Section on the amount of electricity that the reseller
uses or consumes, and shall collect the tax pursuant to subsection A1 of this Section and remit the tax pursuant to subsection
A3 of this Section on the amount of electricity delivered by the reseller to a purchaser.
(2) Any person who delivers electricity to a reseller having an active resale number and complying with all other conditions of
this subsection shall be excused from collecting and remitting the tax on any portion of the electricity delivered to the reseller,
provided that the person reports to the municipality the total amount of electricity delivered to the reseller, and such other
information that the city may reasonably require.
5. Books And Records: Every tax collector, and every taxpayer required to pay the tax imposed by this subsection shall keep
accurate books and records of its business or activity, including contemporaneous books and records denoting the transactions
that gave rise, or may have given rise, to any tax liability under this subsection. The books and records shall be subject to and
available for inspection at all times during business hours of the day.
6. Statute Of Limitations: No action to recover any amount of tax due under the provisions of this subsection A shall be commenced
more than three (3) years after the due date of such amount.
7. Penalties: Any taxpayer who fails to make a return, or who makes a fraudulent return, or who wilfully violates any other provision
of this subsection A is guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be fined not less than one hundred dollars
($100.00) nor more than five hundred dollars ($500.00), and in addition shall be liable in a civil action for the amount of tax due.
(Ord. 99-05, 6-14-1999)
B. Simplified Municipal Telecommunications Tax: The rate of the simplified municipal telecommunications tax imposed under the
provisions of sections 5-25 and 5-30 of the simplified municipal telecommunications tax act, PA 92-0526 is 6.0 percent (in 1/4 percent
increments) that shall take effect for all gross charges billed by telecommunications retailers on and after January 1, 2003. (Ord. 08-
02, 9-9-2002)
C. Gas: Persons engaged in the business of distributing, supplying, furnishing or selling gas for use or consumption within the corporate
limits of the city, and not for resale, at the rate of five percent (5%) of the gross receipts therefrom. (1997 Code)
3-3-3: EXEMPTIONS; REGULATIONS:
No tax is imposed by this chapter with respect to any transaction in interstate commerce or otherwise to the extent to which such
business may not, under the constitution and statutes of the United States, be made subject to taxation by this state or any political
subdivision thereof; nor shall any persons engaged in the business of distributing, supplying, furnishing or selling gas or electricity, or
engaged in the business of transmitting messages be subject to taxation by this state or any political subdivision thereof; nor shall any
persons engaged in the business of distributing, supplying, furnishing or selling gas or electricity, or engaged in the business of
transmitting messages be subject to taxation under the provisions of this chapter for such transactions as are or may become subject to
taxation under the provisions of the "municipal retailers' occupation tax act" authorized by statute and this code. (Ord. 99-05, 6-14-1999)
3-3-4: TAX AS ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION:
Such tax shall be in addition to the payment of money, or value of products or services furnished to the municipality by the taxpayer as
compensation from the use of its streets, alleys or other public places, or installation and maintenance therein, thereon, or thereunder of
poles, wires, pipes or other equipment used in the operation of the taxpayer's business. (Ord. 99-05, 6-14-1999)
3-3-5: RETURN FILED:
A. Initial Return: On or before June 30, each taxpayer not otherwise hereinbefore paying said tax, shall make a return to the city
treasurer for the months of March, April, and May stating:
1. His/her name;
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 52/251
2. His/her principal place of business;
3. His/her gross receipts during those months on the basis of which the tax is imposed;
4. Amount of tax;
5. Such other and related information as the corporate authorities may require.
B. Subsequent Returns: On or before the last day of every third month thereafter, each taxpayer shall make a like return to the city
treasurer for a corresponding three (3) month period. (1997 Code)
3-3-6: PAYMENT:
The taxpayer making the return hereinbefore provided for shall, at the time of making such return, pay to the city treasurer the amount of
tax herein imposed; provided, that in connection with any return, the taxpayer may, if he/she so elects report and pay an amount based
upon his/her total billings of business subject to the tax during the period for which the return is made exclusive of any amount
previously billed, with prompt adjustments of later payments based upon any difference between such billings and the taxable gross
receipts. (1997 Code)
3-3-7: CREDIT FOR OVERPAYMENT:
If it shall appear that an amount of tax has been paid which was not due under the provisions of this chapter, whether as the result of a
mistake of fact or an error of law, then such amount shall be credited against any tax due, or to become due, under this chapter from the
taxpayer who made the erroneous payment; provided that no amounts erroneously paid more than three (3) years prior to the filing of a
claim therefor, shall be so credited. If a taxpayer under this chapter is unable to use a credit authorized by this chapter solely because
the tax imposed by this chapter has been replaced by the tax imposed under subsection 3-3-2A of this chapter then the taxpayer may
apply such credit against any tax due under subsection 3-3-2A of this chapter. (Ord. 99-05, 6-14-1999)
3-3-8: PAYMENTS FROM CITY:
Payments made by the city to persons subject to this chapter shall not be included in the gross receipts of that person and the city shall
be exempt from any charges by such person as are allowed by law because of this chapter. (1997 Code)
Chapter 4
AUTOMATIC AMUSEMENT DEVICES; AMUSEMENT ARCADES1
3-4-1: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this Chapter, the following words and terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this Section:
AMUSEMENT ARCADE: Any business establishment with three (3) or more automatic devices upon its premises and which allows said
automatic amusement devices to be operated thereon for use in games, contests or amusement through the exercise of skill.
AUTOMATIC AMUSEMENT DEVICE: Any machine or pool table which, upon insertion of a coin, slug or token in any slot or receptacle
in the machine or attached thereto, operates for use as a game, contest or amusement through the exercise of skill. (1997 Code)
3-4-2: LICENSE REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful to establish or operate an "amusement arcade", as hereinabove defined, within the City without first obtaining a
license for an amusement arcade from the licensing authority designated by the City Council. The licensing authority shall be an officer
or agency designated by the City Council to be the licensing authority for amusement arcades. (1997 Code)
3-4-3: APPLICATION; FEE:
A. Application; Required Information: All persons seeking a license shall submit an application, in writing, to the licensing authority. Upon
said application, the applicant shall furnish to the licensing authority the following information:
1. The names and addresses of all persons, including corporations, in whose name the application is submitted.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 53/251
2. The address of the location for which the applicant seeks a license.
3. The number and type of automatic amusement devices the applicant proposes to be maintained at said location.
4. The criminal felony conviction record of the applicant, or its officers, if the applicant is a corporation, if any, and, if the applicant
does bear a conviction record of a criminal felony or felonies, any information which the applicant believes would show that the
applicant has been rehabilitated.
B. Action Of Licensing Authority: Within not more than forty five (45) days of receipt of such application, the licensing authority shall
grant or deny the application for license.
C. Fee: The licensing authority shall be empowered to collect with any application for license or renewal application, any license fee
established by the City Council. (1997 Code)
3-4-4: TERM:
A license, if granted, shall be for a period of one year, and shall be automatically renewed from year to year thereafter upon application
and payment of the license fee. (1997 Code)
3-4-5: PREMISES REQUIREMENTS:
A. Location: No amusement arcade shall be located within three hundred feet (300') of any church, grammar or secondary school or
residential zoning district unless such amusement arcade was so located prior to the enactment of this Chapter, or unless the
licensing authority waives the requirements of this provision. Provided, however, that any amusement arcade so located prior to
enactment of this Chapter shall not receive a license pursuant to this Chapter if at any time following such enactment the automatic
amusement devices located on the premises of such amusement arcade are removed.
B. Outside Security Lighting: Outside security lighting must be installed when such lighting is deemed necessary by the licensing
authority and the licensee is notified of this fact. (1997 Code)
3-4-6: DENIAL, REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION:
A license may be denied, revoked or suspended for one or more of the following reasons:
A. Wilful violation of any provision of this Chapter.
B. Conviction of a felony, of any person seeking or holding a license, under any State or Federal law if the licensing authority determines
that such person has not been sufficiently rehabilitated to warrant the public trust.
C. The maximum number of licenses permitted within the City, as the Council shall from time to time determine, have been issued.
D. Wilful violation of any ordnance of the City.
E. Failure to submit a license renewal application and pay the required renewal license fee. (1997 Code)
3-4-7: HEARING PROCEDURE:
A. Notice Of Violation: If the licensing authority shall find probable cause that a licensee or applicant has violated the provisions of this
Chapter or has falsified the application form, the licensing authority shall give written notice thereof by certified mail addressed to the
licensee or applicant. Said notice shall specify the alleged grounds of said violation and shall inform the recipient of his/her right to
demand a hearing before a hearing officer designated for such purpose by the licensing authority.
B. Demand For Hearing: A demand for hearing shall be made in writing to the licensing authority and submitted no later than the tenth
day next succeeding the date of mailing of the aforesaid notice. If no demand for hearing is made within said time, the license shall
forthwith be revoked, suspended or denied.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 54/251
C. Hearing: If a hearing is demanded, it shall be held within ten (10) days thereafter, upon written notice to the party demanding hearing.
D. Hearing Officer: The Hearing Officer for such hearing shall be the Zoning Officer, which officer is empowered to hear testimony, take
evidence, and to make findings of fact.
E. Findings: The Hearing Officer shall thereafter report these findings along with the Hearing Officer's recommendations to the licensing
authority.
F. Action Of Licensing Authority: Upon receipt of the Hearing Officer's findings and recommendations, the licensing authority shall take
final action. (1997 Code)
3-4-8: GENERAL REQUIREMENTS AND RESTRICTIONS:
A. Supervision By Adult: All automatic amusement devices within the premises shall be visible to, and under the supervision of, a
person of adult age.
B. Age Limit; Hours: During the regular school year, excepting weekends or legal holidays, persons under the age of sixteen (16) years
shall not be allowed to operate automatic amusement devices Monday through Friday, between the hours of eight o'clock (8:00) A.M.
and eight o'clock (8:00) P.M., unless accompanied by a parent or authorized guardian.
C. Curfew Enforcement: No persons under the age of sixteen (16) years shall be allowed to enter or remain inside an automatic
amusement arcade after the time for curfew, if any, for persons that age. (1997 Code)
3-4-9: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
Any licensee who, after notice and hearing, is found to have wilfully violated any provision of this Chapter shall be subject to the
following penalties:
A. First Violation: For any first violation, a suspension of license for any period of time not to exceed thirty (30) days in duration;
B. Second Violation: For any second violation, a suspension of license for any period of time not to exceed ninety (90) days in duration;
C. Third Violation: For any third violation or more, either a suspension of license for any period of time not to exceed one hundred twenty
(120) days in duration or a revocation of license.
In addition to other penalties provided for herein, any person in violation of this Chapter shall be subject to penalty as provided in
Section 1-4-1 of this Code. (1997 Code)
Chapter 5
BILLIARD AND POOL HALLS1
3-5-1: LICENSE REQUIRED:
No person shall operate, maintain or conduct a billiard, pool or bagatelle or pigeon hole table open to the public without first obtaining a
license therefor as provided in this Chapter. (1997 Code)
3-5-2: APPLICATION:
All applications for such licenses as specified in Section 3-5-1 of this Chapter shall state thereon the location of the place of business,
the number of tables to be used and the names and addresses of all persons owning all or a share of the business. (1997 Code)
3-5-3: LICENSE FEE:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 55/251
The applicant shall pay therefor such license fee as the City Council shall, from time to time, determine. (1997 Code)
3-5-4: BOND REQUIRED:
No license required by the provisions of this Chapter shall be issued unless the application for said license is accompanied by a bond in
the amount of two thousand dollars ($2,000.00) conditioned to indemnify the City for any loss, damage or liability that may be incurred in
the conduct of such business. (1997 Code)
3-5-5: MINORS:
It shall be unlawful for any minor under the age of sixteen (16) years to enter or remain in any hall licensed under the provisions of this
Chapter; provided, that any such minor may enter if such minor has been ordered to do so by the direction, consent and knowledge of
such minor's parent or guardian, and it shall be unlawful for the proprietor, owner or person in charge to permit any violation of the
provisions of this Section. (1997 Code)
3-5-6: HOURS:
It shall be unlawful for anyone to permit, or for any place licensed under the provisions of this Chapter to permit, the operation of, or the
being open for business of such place between the hours of one minute past twelve o'clock (12:01) midnight and nine o'clock (9:00)
A.M. the following morning. (1997 Code)
Chapter 6
BED AND BREAKFAST ESTABLISHMENTS1
3-6-1: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this Chapter, the following words and terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this Section:
BED AND BREAKFAST ESTABLISHMENT: An operator-occupied residence that provides for a charge accommodation to the public of
no more than five (5) guest rooms and operates more than ten (10) nights in a one year period. Breakfast may be provided to the guests
only. Bed and breakfast establishments shall not include motels, hotels, boarding houses, or food service establishments.
GUEST ROOM: A sleeping room serving no more than two (2) transient adult guests per night.
OPERATOR: The owner or the owner's agent who resides in the bed and breakfast establishment or on contiguous property. (1997
Code)
3-6-2: LICENSE REQUIRED; FEE:
Licensed owner or the owner's agent may apply for a license to operate a bed and breakfast establishment. No establishment shall be
permitted to operate without such license. Such license application shall be submitted to the City Clerk along with the following:
A. Fee: Licensing fee as determined by the City Council from time to time to be necessary for the enforcement of these regulations and
the processing of such application.
B. Liability Insurance: Proof of liability insurance in such minimum coverage as the City Council shall deem from time to time as
necessary for the protection of the public.
C. Authorization To Inspect: Authorization to permit inspections upon proper notice and identification of City inspectors including
building, plumbing and electrical inspectors. (1997 Code)
3-6-3: INSPECTION:
Upon receipt of the application and all other necessary information and documents, the proper inspector or such other employee of the
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 56/251
City as is designated by the City Council shall inspect such establishment to determine compliance with all applicable City ordinances.
Such inspection shall be made within twelve (12) calendar days. (1997 Code)
3-6-4: REGULATIONS AND MINIMUM STANDARDS:
Bed and breakfast establishments in addition to applicable City ordinances shall comply with the requirements and minimum standards
set forth in the Illinois Bed and Breakfast Act, 50 Illinois Compiled Statutes 820/1 et seq., and any subsequent amendments or revisions
of that Act. (1997 Code)
3-6-5: PROOF OF INSURANCE:
The applicant shall provide proof of adequate liability insurance as required by the licensing agency. (1997 Code)
3-6-6: RENEWAL:
Each application and other requirements as are set forth in Section 3-6-2 of this Chapter shall be submitted, annually, two (2) weeks
prior to the anniversary date of the issuance of the first license. (1997 Code)
3-6-7: VIOLATION AND NONCOMPLIANCE:
If the inspecting authority, after completing an inspection, shall determine that such establishment has failed to comply with the
provisions of this Chapter or any other applicable City ordinance or State law, such inspecting authority shall issue a notice in writing.
(1997 Code)
3-6-8: HEARING:
A. Request For Hearing: Any operator affected by such notice may request, in writing, a hearing before such body as the City Council
shall, from time to time, deem appropriate for such hearings. Such request must be filed within five (5) calendar days after receipt by
the operator of the notice by certified mail from the inspecting authority.
B. Notice Of Hearing: Such hearing shall be conducted within fifteen (15) calendar days after receipt by the City Clerk of a request.
Notice of the time and date of such hearing shall be given to the operator five (5) calendar days prior to the hearing date and
delivered by certified mail.
C. Action Of Hearing Officer: The Hearing Officer shall conduct a hearing taking the testimony of the operator and the inspector. Upon
hearing such other witnesses as have relevant information concerning the notice, the Hearing Officer may extend the time for
compliance beyond that provided for by the inspecting authority, may modify or withdraw the notice, or take such other actions as is
necessary to protect the public and provide substantial justice.
D. Decision Of Hearing Officer: The determination of the Hearing Officer shall be in writing in five (5) calendar days following the hearing
unless such time is extended for good cause. The decision of the Hearing Officer shall be final. (1997 Code)
3-6-9: PENALTY:
A. Revocation Of License: Any operator found to be in violation of any applicable ordinance including this Chapter or of State law and
having failed to comply with such ordinance or State law upon proper notice shall have their license revoked after a hearing for that
purpose before the Hearing Officer upon five (5) calendar days notice of the time, date and place of such hearing.
B. Misdemeanor: In the event that the Hearing Officer finds at such hearing that the operator's noncompliance is without reasonable
cause or grounds, such operator shall further be guilty of a misdemeanor and, if convicted, shall be subject to penalty as provided in
Section 1-4-1 of this Code. Each day's violation shall constitute a separate offense. Such operator may be subject to being charged
with such violation either before or after the hearing provided for in this Section. (1997 Code)

Chapter 8
FOOD DELIVERY VEHICLES1
3-8-1: LICENSE REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful to use or permit the use of any vehicle, including wagons and motor vehicles propelled by human power, for the
storage or carrying of any meat, milk, poultry, fish, butter, cheese, lard, vegetables, bread or bakery products, or any other provisions
intended for human consumption, including beverages, in the City for the purpose of delivering any such foodstuffs to any place in the
City for their use and consumption unless a license for such vehicle is first secured and the provisions of this Chapter are fully complied
with. (1997 Code)
3-8-2: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE:
Applications for such licenses shall be made to the City Clerk and shall recite the name and address of the owner of the vehicle, the
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 58/251
name of the person for whom such deliveries are made and nature of the goods carried. The Clerk shall issue such licenses and shall
give to the Mayor a list of all such licenses issued. (1997 Code)
3-8-3: LICENSE FEE:
The annual fee for such license shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00) for each vehicle, and shall be issued for one year. Such fees
shall be paid to the City Clerk, who shall turn them over to the City Treasurer forthwith. (1997 Code)
3-8-4: EXEMPTION:
No license fee shall be required for any vehicle used to deliver foodstuffs from any establishment which is licensed and inspected as a
food-dealing establishment in the City; but all provisions of this Chapter, other than that providing for the payment of a fee, shall be
complied with in connection with such vehicle. (1997 Code)
3-8-5: SANITATION REGULATIONS:
A. Cleanliness: All such vehicles shall be kept in a clean and sanitary condition and shall be thoroughly cleaned each day they are so
used.
B. Waste Material: It shall be unlawful to permit stale food, decaying matter, or any other waste material or product to accumulate in or
on any such vehicle while it is so used.
C. Dust; Insects: If unwrapped foodstuffs are transported in any such vehicle, such goods will be carried in a portion or compartment of
the vehicle which is screened or protected against dust and insects. (1997 Code)
3-8-6: INSPECTIONS:
It shall be the duty of the Mayor to make or cause to be made such inspections as may be necessary to ensure compliance with the
provisions of this Chapter. (1997 Code)
3-8-7: REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
A. Revocation By Mayor: Any license issued under the provisions of this Chapter may be revoked by the Mayor for any violation of any
regulation hereof and such revocations shall be in addition to any fine imposed by virtue of this Section.
B. Notice Of Revocation: The licensing authority shall give written notice thereof by certified mail addressed to the licensee or applicant.
Said notice shall specify the alleged grounds of said violation and shall inform the recipient of recipient's right to demand a hearing
before a hearing officer designated for such purpose by the licensing authority.
C. Demand For Hearing: A demand for hearing shall be made in writing to the licensing authority and submitted no later than the tenth
day next succeeding the date of mailing of the aforesaid notice. If no demand for hearing is made within said time, the license shall
forthwith be revoked, suspended or denied.
D. Hearing: If a hearing is demanded, it shall be held within ten (10) days thereafter, upon written notice to the party demanding hearing.
E. Hearing Officer: The Hearing Officer for such hearing shall be the Zoning Officer and is empowered to hear testimony, take evidence,
and to make findings of fact.
F. Findings: The Hearing Officer shall thereafter report these findings along with the Hearing Officer's recommendation to the licensing
authority.
G. Action Of Licensing Authority: Upon receipt of the Hearing Officer's findings and recommendations, the licensing authority shall take
final action. (1997 Code)

Chapter 9
TAXICABS1
3-9-1: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this Chapter, the following word shall have the meaning ascribed to it in this Section:
TAXICAB: Any public passenger vehicle transporting passengers for hire on a trip basis to or from a destination as directed by the
passenger. (1997 Code)
3-9-2: LICENSE REQUIRED:
No automobile, autocar, cab or other similar vehicle shall be used for the transportation of persons for hire within the City, whether the
said automobile, autocar or other similar vehicle secures its passengers from a public stand or stands upon the street or whether the
same is kept in a private garage, unless every such vehicle be licensed as hereinafter provided. (1997 Code)
3-9-3: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE; FEE:
A. Form; Required Information: The owner of any such automobile, autocar, cab or other similar vehicle for which it is desired to secure
a license shall make application to the City Clerk, setting forth therein the name of such owner, a description of the vehicle for which
it is desired to secure a license, and the place where such vehicle is kept, if the same is kept in a private garage. The application
shall be provided by the said Clerk.
B. Bond; Insurance; Certificate Of Safety; Fee: Upon receipt of such application and upon proof being submitted to the Clerk that the
applicant has complied with the provisions of the Illinois State law pertaining to surety bonds or insurance policies by reason of the
operation of such vehicle, and upon proof that said vehicle has been tested and a certificate of safety issued thereon, the Clerk shall
issue or cause to be issued a license for such vehicle upon the payment by the applicant of a license fee as determined from time to
time by the City Council for each vehicle. (1997 Code)
3-9-4: SAFETY TEST REQUIRED:
A. Maintenance: Every taxicab operated on streets of the City shall be kept and maintained in a good and safe mechanical condition.
B. Safety Test: Every such taxicab, within fifteen (15) days before application for license is made, shall be subjected to the safety test
provided by an official testing station as established and set up by 625 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/13-101 et seq. Said safety test
shall include the testing and inspection of brakes, lights, horns, reflectors, rear view mirrors, safety chains, frames, axles, body,
wheels, steering apparatus and other safety devices and appliances. The passing of the safety test shall not be a bar at any time to
prosecution for operating or causing to be operated a taxicab not in good and safe mechanical condition.
C. Display Of Certificate: If the taxicab is in safe mechanical condition, the operator of the official testing station shall at once issue and
affix to said taxicab a certificate of safety which shall at all times be displayed on said taxicab.
D. Subsequent Certification: No certificate of safety issued during the second six (6) months of the license year shall be of any effect
after the first day of the succeeding year.
E. Testing, Display Required: No taxicab shall be operated upon the street, alleys or public places of said City without having been
tested as herein required or without having said certificate of safety displayed on said taxicab. (1997 Code)
3-9-5: INSIGNIA; EMBLEM:
A. Required; Specifications: Every automobile, autocar, cab or other similar vehicle licensed under the provisions of this Chapter shall
have the name of the owner thereof plainly painted in letters at least one and one-half inches (11/2") in height, and the number of the
license plainly painted in numbers at least four inches (4") in height, in a conspicuous place on the outside of each side of such
vehicle, and such name and number shall be kept so painted plainly and distinctly at all times while such vehicle is in use during the
continuance of such license.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 60/251
B. Removal: Upon the expiration of such license (unless same is forthwith renewed) such name and number shall be at once erased
from such vehicle and such vehicle shall not thereafter be used with such name or number thereon. (1997 Code)
3-9-6: ARTICLES LEFT IN TAXICABS:
Whenever any package, article, baggage or goods of any kind shall be left in or upon any vehicle licensed under the provisions of this
Chapter, the operator of such vehicle shall, upon discovery of such package, baggage or goods, forthwith deliver the same to the
policeman on duty at the police station in the City. (1997 Code)
3-9-7: REFUSAL TO CONVEY PASSENGER:
No person licensed as aforesaid when unemployed and his/her legal fare is paid or tendered to him/her, shall, without lawful excuse,
refuse to convey within the City any person, with or without baggage, as aforesaid when applied to for that purpose, or having
undertaken to convey such person, shall omit or neglect to do so, under the penalty herein prescribed. (1997 Code)
3-9-8: FARE PAYMENT IN ADVANCE:
Any person licensed as set forth in this Chapter may demand his/her legal fare to be paid in advance by any person seeking to employ
him/her, and may refuse to convey any person who shall fail to comply with such demand. Any person so licensed shall give to any
person requesting the same his/her name and the number of his/her license. (1997 Code)
3-9-9: PENALTY:
Every person who shall keep, use or operate, or be in charge, possession or control of, or cause to be kept, used or operated upon any
of the streets or public ways of the City any automobile, autocar, cab or other similar vehicle for the conveyance of passengers for hire
or reward which has not been licensed in accordance with the provisions of this Chapter or who keeps, uses or operates, or causes to
be kept, used or operated, any such automobile, autocar, or other similar vehicle in violation of any of the provisions of this Chapter shall
be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor. (1997 Code)
Chapter 10
SCAVENGERS
3-10-1: DEFINITION:
As used in this Chapter, the following word shall have the meaning ascribed to it in this Section:
SCAVENGER: One who engages in the business or occupation of collecting and hauling for the purpose of disposal or otherwise, any
garbage, refuse, junk or other trash or material. (1997 Code)
3-10-2: LICENSE REQUIRED; FEE:
It shall be unlawful for any person to engage in the business of a scavenger or the collection or disposal of animal or vegetable refuse or
offal without having first secured a license therefor. The annual fee for such license shall be three hundred dollars ($300.00) due May 1
each year. (1997 Code)
3-10-3: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE:
Application for such license to operate in the City as a scavenger shall be made to the City Clerk, and shall be referred by the City Clerk
to the City Council. No such license shall be issued except on the order of the City Council. (1997 Code)
3-10-4: LIABILITY COVERAGE:
All applicants shall, when making applications for license hereunder, tender to the City Clerk a certificate of insurance certifying to
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 61/251
liability coverage in the amount of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) for each accident and a total aggregate coverage of
three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000.00). (1997 Code)
3-10-5: VEHICLE REQUIREMENTS:
Any vehicle used by such scavenger in his business shall be watertight, and equipped with airtight covers for such portions as are used
for the transportation of refuse. (1997 Code)
3-10-6: SUNDAYS PROHIBITED:
It shall be unlawful for any vehicle to be driven over or through any street in the City during or on Sundays. (1997 Code)
3-10-7: DISPOSAL OF REFUSE:
It shall be unlawful for any scavenger to dispose of or store any refuse any place in the City limits or within one mile thereof without first
securing the written permission of the City Council. (1997 Code)
Chapter 11
GARAGE, YARD SALES
3-11-1: DEFINITION:
As used in this Chapter, the following words or terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this Section:
YARD, GARAGE OR BASEMENT SALE: The holding out for sale of any new, used or antique household goods, utensils or appliances;
tools; books; papers or magazines; bric-a-brac; curios; clothing; jewelry; toys; sporting goods; cosmetics; or similar household items to
the general public and conducted on or about premises zoned for single or multi-family residential use or used as a private residence.
(1997 Code)
3-11-2: PERMIT REQUIRED; CONDITIONS; FEE:
A. Permit Required: It shall be unlawful for any person to conduct a yard, garage or basement sale, as hereinbefore defined, on or about
premises zoned for residential use unless such person shall first obtain from the office of the City Clerk a permit for such a yard or
garage sale.
B. Display Of Permit: The permit must be displayed in a prominent place during time of sale.
C. Duration; Fee: No permit shall be granted or issued for more than three (3) consecutive days and shall be issued only upon the
completion and submission of an application form approved by the City Clerk, and upon the payment of a permit fee which the City
Council may from time to time provide. (1997 Code)
3-11-3: LIMITATION ON NUMBER OF SALES:
Yard, garage and basement sales at any one residential location or address shall be limited in number to no more than six (6) such
sales during any one calendar year and a maximum of two (2) such sales during any one calendar month. (1997 Code)
3-11-4: RECORD OF PERMITS:
It shall be the duty and responsibility of the City Clerk to maintain a record of the permits issued and the location for which such permits
are issued. (1997 Code)
3-11-5: PENALTY:
Any person in violation of this Chapter shall be subject penalty as provided in Section 1-4-1 of this Code. Each day a person is in
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 62/251
violation of this Chapter shall constitute a separate violation. (1997 Code)
Chapter 12
KENNELS AND PET SHOPS
3-12-1: LICENSE REQUIRED:
No person shall engage in the business of buying, selling or dealing in birds, dogs, and other small animals used as household pets and
for domestic purposes without first obtaining a license. (1997 Code)
3-12-2: APPLICATION:
Any person desiring a license required by this Chapter shall make written application to the City Clerk, stating the name and residence
of the applicant and the place at which the applicant intends or desires to carry on the business, giving the street location as well as a
description of the premises. (1997 Code)
3-12-3: LICENSE FEE:
A. Less Than Twenty: Any person desiring a license required by this Chapter, where not less than three (3) and not more than a total of
twenty (20) birds, dogs, cats, and other small animals are held for sale as household pets and for domestic purposes shall pay a
license fee of fifteen dollars ($15.00) annually.
B. More Than Twenty: Where more than twenty (20) birds, dogs, cats and other small animals are held for sale as household pets and
for domestic purposes, the license fee shall be fifty dollars ($50.00) annually. (1997 Code)
3-12-4: INVESTIGATION:
Upon the filing of an application for a license required by this Chapter, it shall be the duty of the Building Inspector or other person or
persons designated by the City Council to cause an investigation to be made of the premises named and described in the application for
the purpose of determining the fitness and suitability of the premises for the business from a public health standpoint. The Building
Inspector or other person or persons designated by the City Council shall transmit to the City Council the application, together with
his/her recommendation for or against the issuance of the license. (1997 Code)
3-12-5: ISSUANCE OF LICENSE:
If the City Council shall be satisfied that the applicant or its chief officers, if applicant is a corporation, is in conformity with the provisions
of this Chapter, the City Clerk, upon payment by the applicant of the license fee prescribed in this Chapter, shall issue a license to the
applicant. (1997 Code)
3-12-6: TERM OF LICENSE:
Each license issued shall expire on April 30 following the date of its issuance. (1997 Code)
Chapter 13
TELECOMMUNICATIONS INFRASTRUCTURE MAINTENANCE FEE
(Rep. by Ord. 08-02, 9-9-2002)
Chapter 14
AUTOMOBILE SALES AND DEALERSHIPS
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 63/251
3-14-1: DEFINITION:
"Automobile dealership" is defined as a business engaged in the display of vehicles for sale within the city of Colona which sells four (4)
or more vehicles in any year. Sale of such vehicles need not have occurred on premises. The display of such vehicles resulting in these
sales within a year is to be enough to meet this definition. (Ord. 0-15-014, 9-15-2015)
3-14-2: VEHICLE REQUIREMENTS:
A. All vehicles located on premises for display or sale shall have titles available on the premises for inspection at all times.
B. All such vehicles shall be properly insured and shall meet all state requirements concerning maintenance and display for public sale.
(Ord. 0-15-014, 9-15-2015)
3-14-3: BUSINESS REQUIREMENTS:
A. Any dealership located within the city limits of the city of Colona shall have its own license to do business and transact such
business, and shall be both licensed and registered with the state of Illinois, and such license and registration must be available for
inspection at all times. The license of a dealership shall only be for the designated location within the city of Colona.
B. Any business operating under the authority of a license granted by the state of Illinois by virtue of an exhibition permit for vehicle
dealers shall be required to meet the following obligations in the city of Colona:
1. The maximum concentration of vehicles will be determined for each individual dealership by the zoning officer. In no event shall
there be more than one vehicle for every two hundred (200) square feet of established parking area on exhibitor's property.
2. There shall be an annual license fee payable on May 1 of each year, in the amount of one hundred dollars ($100.00) in addition to
the initial fee due upon license issuance. If a license is issued at any time during a year there shall be a proration of the annual
fee. All fees are nontransferable. (Ord. 0-15-014, 9-15-2015)
Chapter 14A
USED MOTOR VEHICLES AND PARTS BUSINESSES
3-14A-1: LICENSE REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful for any person to engage in the business of buying, selling, exchanging or dealing in used or secondhand motor
vehicles and used or secondhand parts of motor vehicles without first having obtained a license from the state. Proof of said license
shall be submitted to the city.
There shall be an annual license fee payable on May 1 of each year in the amount of one hundred dollars ($100.00), in addition to the
initial fee due upon license issuance. If a license is issued at any time during a year there shall be a proration of the annual fee. All fees
are nontransferable.
Existing used or secondhand dealerships within the city at the time of passage hereof shall be grandfathered for the remainder of the
year of passage and adoption of this chapter. The existing licensed dealerships shall not be transferrable without the permission of such
transfer from the city mayor and council. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-2: SEPARATE LICENSE FOR EACH LOCATION:
A separate license shall be required for each location, place, or premises where a business or occupation regulated by this chapter is
proposed to be carried on. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-3: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE:
Application for a license required by this chapter shall be made in writing to the city clerk and shall state the following:
A. The name of the applicant, and if a corporation, the names of the principal officers and the name of one or more persons whom the
corporation shall designate as manager or person in charge;
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 64/251
B. The location of the place or premises at or on which it is desired to carry on such business;
C. The length of time which the applicant has resided in the city, or if a corporation or association, the length of time which the manager
or person in charge has resided in the city;
D. What type of shop the applicant maintains in connection with the principal place of business in the city and whether it is equipped to
service and repair the types of makes of cars which the applicant intends to sell; and
E. Such other reasonable and pertinent information as the city council may from time to time require. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-4: INVESTIGATION OF APPLICATION FOR LICENSE:
Upon receipt of an application for a license required by this chapter, the city clerk shall refer it to the chief of police, who shall conduct an
investigation to determine whether or not:
A. The applicant is a person of good moral character or, if a partnership, the partners are of good moral character;
B. The applicant is a bona fide resident of the state, and the manager of the applicant's business is a bona fide resident of the city;
C. The applicant proposes to engage in a legitimate used car business; and
D. The proposed business location would constitute a nuisance, fire hazard, or in any way jeopardize the safety of citizens. (Ord. 0-15-
015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-5: LICENSE ISSUANCE; REJECTION:
When the chief of police has completed the investigation required by section 3-14A-4 of this chapter, the application and findings shall
be referred to the city council for further action. If it shall appear to the council from the investigation by the chief of police that the
license applied for should be issued and the applicable sections of this chapter have been complied with, the council may direct the city
clerk to issue the license; otherwise, it may reject the application. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-6: PERSONS ELIGIBLE FOR LICENSE:
No license required by this chapter shall be issued to any person unless the business to be licensed is to be operated by and for the
benefit of the person applying for such license. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-7: LICENSEE TO BE OWNER OR BENEFICIARY OF LICENSED BUSINESS:
It shall be unlawful for a person licensed pursuant to this chapter to engage in business, delineated in this chapter unless he is the
owner of such business, or unless the business is conducted for the benefit of such licensee. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-8: LICENSE NONTRANSFERABLE OR ASSIGNABLE; EXCEPTIONS:
No license issued pursuant to this chapter shall be transferred or assigned by the licensee. However, if the business licensed under this
chapter descends by the laws of intestacy, or by devise or bequest comes into the ownership of any other person, the license shall
automatically be transferred to the person who so acquires such business, subject to compliance with the terms of sections 3-14A-4 and
3-14A-5 of this chapter. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-9: EXPIRATION DATE OF LICENSE:
All licenses issued pursuant to this chapter shall expire on March 31 following the issuance of such licenses. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-10: RENEWAL OF LICENSE:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 65/251
All applications for renewal of licenses required by this chapter shall be referred by the city clerk to the council for its approval or
disapproval. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-11: GROUNDS FOR REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
The city council may, at any time, revoke a license issued under this chapter for any of the following reasons:
A. Conviction of the applicant or license holder of the violation of any section of this chapter or any section of this code which is related
to the licensee's business or any other violation of a statute applicable to the licensee's business or that would render the licensee an
unfit person to conduct such business;
B. The obtaining of or an attempt to obtain a license by fraudulent misrepresentation;
C. Fraud or dishonesty in any transaction relating to such business;
D. Failure to keep authentic records of business transaction relating to such business;
E. Failure to maintain a shop in connection with the applicant's principal place of business in the city tooled and equipped satisfactorily
to service or repair, in accordance with the standards set by the council, the makes and types of cars sold by the licensee. (Ord. 0-
15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-12: PARENTAL CONSENT REQUIRED TO DEAL WITH MINORS:
It shall be unlawful for any person licensed pursuant to this chapter to purchase or receive property from a minor without the written
consent of the minor's parent or guardian. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
Chapter 15
HOTEL/MOTEL TAX
3-15-1: IMPOSED:
A tax of five percent (5%) is imposed upon the gross rent charged for the privilege of renting and using a hotel or motel room within the
city of Colona for each twenty four (24) hour period or any portion of a twenty four (24) hour period. The tax shall not be levied and
imposed upon any person who rents a hotel or motel room for more than thirty (30) consecutive days or to a person who works and lives
in the same hotel or motel. (Ord. 01-06, 1-23-2006)
3-15-2: DEFINITIONS:
HOTEL/MOTEL ROOM: A room in a structure offered for rental on a daily basis, excluding permanent residents who occupy a room in
excess of thirty (30) consecutive days. One room offered for rent with or without an adjoining bath shall be considered a single
hotel/motel room. The number of hotel/motel rooms within a suite shall be computed on the basis of those rooms used for sleeping
purposes.
OWNER: Any person possessing an ownership interest in or conducting or operating a hotel or motel room or otherwise receiving cash
consideration for the rental of hotel or motel rooms.
PERSON: Any natural individual, firm, partnership, association, joint stock company, joint adventure, public or private corporation,
limited liability company or a receiver, executor, trustee, guardian or other representative appointed by order of any court. (Ord. 01-06,
1-23-2006)
3-15-3: COLLECTION:
A. The ultimate incidence of liability for payment of the tax is the person who seeks the privilege of occupying the hotel or motel room,
referred to as the "renter".
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=989 66/251
B. The tax shall be paid in addition to any and all other taxes and charges. The owner of every hotel or motel shall secure payment of
the tax from the renter of the hotel or motel room.
C. The owner shall pay over to the accounts and finance representatives of the city of Colona the tax under procedures prescribed by
the city of Colona or as otherwise specified in this chapter.
D. Every person required to collect the tax shall secure receipt of payment of the tax from the renter at the time the person who collects
the rental payment for use of the hotel/motel room. (Ord. 01-06, 1-23-2006)
3-15-4: BOOKS AND RECORDS:
The city of Colona accounts and finance department representatives may enter the premises of any hotel or motel for the inspection and
examination of records in order to assure the proper administration of this chapter, and to assure the enforcement and collection of the
tax. No person shall prevent, hinder, or interfere with the city of Colona accounts and finance representatives in the discharge of duties
authorized or prescribed under this chapter. Every owner shall keep accurate and complete books and records, available for inspection
at all reasonable times by the city of Colona, including a daily sheet showing the number of hotel or motel rooms rented during a twenty
four (24) hour period, including multiple rentals of the same hotel or motel rooms, and the actual hotel or motel tax receipts collected by
date. (Ord. 01-06, 1-23-2006)
3-15-5: PAYMENT:
A. Commencing on March 1, 2006, the owner or owners of each hotel or motel room within the city of Colona shall file a tax return,
showing tax receipts received with respect to each hotel or motel room during each month, commencing on or after February 1,
2006. The return shall be due on or before the last day of each succeeding calendar month and the return shall indicate the monthly
return period. For example a return filed on or before the last day of February shall indicate tax receipts for the preceding period of
January 1 through January 31. If the owner's average monthly tax receipts do not exceed one hundred dollars ($100.00) when using
as a minimum the last six (6) consecutive months as a database, the accounts and finance representatives of the city of Colona may
authorize the owner to file a return on a quarterly basis, with returns for January, February, and March due on or before April 30 of
each year, with the return for April, May, and June due on or before July 31, with the return for July, August, and September due on
or before October 31, and the return for October, November, and December due on or before January 31.
B. If the tax is not paid when due, a penalty at the rate of one and one-half percent (11/2%) for a thirty (30) day period, or a prorated
